title: What should I name my band? - Quora

response.answer_text: The name should fit who you are and the music you make. I do not know you are, and have no idea what your music sounds like. So any suggestion I can make will be uninformed by this. This does put everybody here at a disadvantage. Sometimes, though, it is good if someone just hands you a list of possibilities and that might open up your mind to others that do suit you. So, I’ll leave you with a small list of diverse names. Some of these names mean something beyond what you read. So look them up. Axiom Of Choice (math therm) Bass Instinct Beyond Rock Functor (math term) Rumble Revitalize Whatever you decide, the name has to `feel’ right. There is no other way to say it. But when it does, you will know. The problem with four people though is that not everyone might feel it right for the same name. Good luck

Hard question to answer because the band, or at least the key members need to agree. I usually start by throwing out names I think are good, and aren’t in use by another band. That usually doesn’t work, and my projects are stuck without a name. I have a project now that is ready to do shows but we can’t find a name, so I feel you. I would suggest that you take a brainstorming approach, just write down as many names as possible, everything you can think of that is decent. Don’t worry about how good they are. Then go back and cut the ones that you don’t like, see if the names are in use, and come up with a short list to pitch to interested parties. Rinse repeat until you have a name. This has always worked for me, sans the most recent project. Opinions on band names are all over the map, so it is hard to recommend something without knowing the music and people involved.

Depends on what your theme is. I mean, I understand you’re a rock/funk band, but what’s the theme you’re trying to convey? What kind of audience are you trying to reach out to? What do you want to be described as? What do you think describes your gig the best? All these are questions you should definitely consider answering by yourself and with your band before you think of a name. What are we? is the #1 question. It’s okay if you initially don’t come up with a smart name off the bat, or if the lot of you don’t all agree on a single name firsthand. After some time, you’ll all find something that you all like. The name of the band is usually the last thing to think of when forming one, so don’t worry. Of course, I am great at naming things, so if you can’t really find a name but you can answer all the questions I gave you above, you can just drop your thoughts in the comments, and I’d be more than happy to help you find a good name :)

The etymology of band names is something of relative fascination for most musicians and fans. In most cases, band names have a specific meaning or relevance to the band members themselves - ABBA, for instance, is a palindromic acronym formed from the initials of the first names of the band members (Agnetha, Björn, Benny and Anni-Frid). With the band Imagine Dragons on the other hand, the background behind the name is a secret known only to the band members; although they have released that the name is actually an anagram made from the letters of different words, the origin words are stil unknown. There are of course instances of band names having no specific meaning or importance to the band. Aerosmith was just a name invented by the band’s drummer Joey Kramer and Blur was selected from a list of names offered by the label after the band was signed and forced to change their name. You mention “a rock/funk foursome” - so possibly using a play on that description - Funk4Fire - or even creating your own portmanteau by combining or blending words - Funkversation (like a funky conversation) will lead you to your new band name.

“Wheeping Scrotus” “Clearance Creedwater Revival” “Biffalo Bob and his Twat-Burgalers” “Drums n’ Shit” “Bryce” “Paranoid Crow” “FURRE” “Old Order” “Copybook” “Smythe & Fukker” “Bob Dole’s Playground” “Niche Parade” “Nouveau Rick” “[]”
Flat As A Tyre Big Fat Tires

“Free Beer Tonight” is a classic. Cheese Hogs. Those Guys. The Character Actors. The Character Assassins. The Sidekicks Surf Neutron The Virgins TapedGlasses Mr No It All Peabody and Company Eats Shoots And Leaves
All of your music is original, but you can’t think of a name?
My current band had considered the name Kick the Dog or Kick, the Dog. Maybe even Shave A Cat
Which type of music do you play?
THE FUNKY FOURS THE UNFORGETTABLES I dunno if they work!
